title: 305. The Demonization of Gluten
description: Celiac disease is thought to affect roughly one percent of the population. The good news: it can be treated by quitting gluten. The bad news: many celiac patients haven't been diagnosed. The weird news: millions of people without celiac disease have quit gluten – which may be a big mistake.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
